title: Plant Science Inquiry: Cultivating Future Botanical Investigators

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic biological concepts and foundational knowledge of plant physiology
context.additional_context: A course designed for general citizens to experience real-world plant science research cases and learn research methodologies, offering a blended learning environment combining digital devices and offline experiments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the impact of genetic variation in plants on their form and function.
Learners can identify plant variations by applying a research-based problem-solving process.
Learners can collect and interpret data by acquiring the skills to use plant science research tools (microscopes, spectrometers, etc.).
Learners can explain the interconnections between plant genetics, biochemistry, and physiology.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
